Whie, holie Mother, whie dothe ruthlesse Honde</br>Thus smyte thie Gates of hoarie Majestie?</br>Workynge rude Spoyle, wheere Scyence kepte her Stonde,</br>Contente to flowte all gawdie Fantasie.</br>Staie, Holie Mother, staie such Vanitie,</br>Albe soe trym, this noughte beseemythe thee.

No goodlie Syghte of Bedesman's connyng Celle,</br>Wheare Urchyn Wysdome crawlyde forthe thie Lappe;</br>No sturdie Porche, wheare Valor's Chylde dyd dwelle,</br>Swyllyng his Lore from oute thie plenteous Pappe.</br>Staie, Holie Mother, staie such Vanitie,</br>Albe soe trym, this noughte beseemythe thee.

Att wontede Noone, thie Trenchermenne unseene,</br>Att Eve, unhearde thie Chaunte of godlie Tonge.</br>More godlie farre, soche holie Chaunte I weene,</br>Than mottrynge Clerke, wyth Masse ne sayde ne songe.</br>Staie, Holie Mother, staie such Vanitie,</br>Albe soe trym, this noughte beseemythe thee.

Nyghtes starrie Hoste, mydst steadie Pathe dothe byde,</br>Ne soffrythe Chaunge thylke Lampe whych rulythe Daie;</br>Ah lett not Showe of Mortals wytlesse Pryde!</br>Bedymm thie heavenlie Cowrse, swete Saunte!  we praie.</br>Staie, Holie Mother, staie such Vanitie,</br>Nor be more trymm, than erste beseemyde thee.</br>
